Reviews.Title: “Really a good place.”
Reviews.Author: Whatta F
Reviews.Content: Very clean and comfortable room. In my case, the employees was very helpfull. I spend a wonderfull time on Venice thanks to this people. :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: ElizaGunn
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel very conveniently placed for San Marco Square. The staff were extremely pleasant and very helpful. The room was clean, beding and towels changed every day. Breakfast was adequate. As it was carnival time Venice was extremely crowded and everything was very expensive. Travel by water bus was more expensive than I had remembered from previous visits but it may be that the 'travel cards' were not well advertised during Carnival and each trip was paid for separately. We did buy two return tickets to Lido. Having scanned them on the way over they would not work on the way back. We ended up having to buy two more single tickets - a very expensive 10 minutes on the water at a total of 39 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a bit over priced.”
Reviews.Author: Elk555
Reviews.Content: Service was so/so. Receptionist was slow to check us in but room was clean. It was clean, near San Marco's. A bit pricey for what you are getting, but I guess that's how everything is in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this place”
Reviews.Author: Bellabella907
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very small, staff is unkind and even rude with the guests ( specially an assistant manager called Massimo). for what you are paying here, you can really find a better place where you will be treated with respect and have nicer accommodations

Reviews.Title: “Nothing "Royal" about it.....”
Reviews.Author: pathdoc1215
Reviews.Content: The location was amazing for this hotel. It was right by the San Marco Basilica. The issue is, just about all the hotels in the city are close together and Venice is not that big so in reality-the location just does not justify sleeping in a room that has such an old mattress (it was sagging in the center), with dim lighting, dirty/grungy shower, and rude staff. The staff had absolutely no suggestions and were super rude (the women, not the men-the men were nice). The internet will cost you 25 euros per 24 hours so be prepared if you would like internet. The overall lack of cleanliness is enough to overcompensate for the location.

Reviews.Title: “RUDE staff and tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: tvlgrl11
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here with a group and a booking error was made by staff. They refused to take resonsibilty and tried to blame me also wanted to wake up the guest at 10:30 PM and have her change rooms. They are very argumentative. The rooms are tiny and don't look at all like the website. The location and breakfast is good though.

Reviews.Title: “Don't ever stay here”
Reviews.Author: Robert T
Reviews.Content: The shower flooded badly all over the floor and management ignored our request to fix the problem . This occurred everyday we were in the hotel. Impossible to use the hair dryer as floor was so wet. Toilets were not cleaned daily. General cleanliness was poor. No way this is a 4 star hotel as claimed - 2 star at best Breakfast was well below standard - no service

Reviews.Title: “4 star, down grade to 3”
Reviews.Author: travelloverszamswiss
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location, however the rooms were just too too tiny. I know its Venice but reall they were small. It was ok to stay but should be brough a star down

Reviews.Title: “Cold, Impersonal and Not Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: Konark77
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel becasue of the location and the 4-star rating. In Venice everything is more expensive than the rest of Italy anyway, and I wanted to ensure we chose a good place rather than a price-based room. Having said that, this is nowhere close to being a four star hotel - go elsewhere. Reasons are: - The rooms are older and less comfortable than they appear - The bathrooms were old and shower head was dirty from lack of cleaning. In addition, it was set on some sort of high pressure wash that actually stung... when you turned the nozzle to change the flow it made no difference. You had to bear through it - There was a TV in the room, but it wasn't plugged in and since there was no power outlet nearby, and no power strip to bring power to it, I'm not sure it had any functionality whatsoever... at least TRY to make it look like you care. - Customer Service was poor all around. Of the four people at the desk only one smiled when you came up and asked a question. Most acted bored of the 'silly tourist questions' like 'What's the easiest way to get to the airport?' - My wife is pregnant and was feeling tired so we decided to take it easy the day we were to leave. We asked if they had a late checkout option (which ALL 4-star hotels have... that's why you choose them) and they said no, that we had to get out by noon because they were booked up and needed the room. I even understand this, but it wasn't in a nice, customer service way... they were unhappy with us even asking the question and made that clear. - We asked for the tour options they had in the brochure sitting at their front desk and they told us to walk out and upto the local spots (different for every tour) and negotiate for ourselves... no desire to pick up the phone and help us out. All in all... if you want a 4 star hotel, dont stay here. If you want a 3 star hotel, don't stay here. If you want a 2-star hotel in a central location... this is the place you want...

Reviews.Title: “Vermeiden”
Reviews.Author: Jim008
Reviews.Content: As tour leader of a group of art patrons visiting the Biennale I was witness to the dissatisfaction of the whole group (seven persons) during their four-day stay. The rooms were small and unkept, the breakfast was very limited, and the personnel unfrendly and not especially helpful. It's hard to imagine how this hotel can be rated as four-star. I can not recommend this hotel toany visitor to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “average level in Venice, but the location is great”
Reviews.Author: suiren
Reviews.Content: The hotels in Venice in certain seasons are furiously expensive. You really cannot get anything for what you are paying. With really high price you will be disappointed with a dark, small even not a clean room with a space you hardly can open your suitcase. With these past experiences I became quite cynical for Venice hotels. But I came back to this hotel again, because it is located in a very convenient location, just behind the Piazza San Marco, and the room - is not really so bad. The reception staffs - are overall kind and professional in an average level. Also the e-mail person who took care of my reservation ( had to change a few times ) were very quick and efficient. So I am quite satisfied with this one here, but if this is not located in Venice, I think I will not coming back for a humble small room for this money.

Reviews.Title: “room for sale”
Reviews.Author: elainefantasy
Reviews.Content: hello i stayed here before it was wonderful but this time i booked the trip and can no longer make the trip. please contact me directly if you are interested in the rooms below asap, it's located in the best area in venice st mark's square: Hotel Royal San Marco Address San Marco 848, San Marco Venice, 30124 Italy Check in Friday, July 22, 2011, check-in after 14:00 Check out Tuesday, July 26, 2011, check-out before 11:00 Hotel page http://www.booking.com/hotel/it/royalsanmarco.html?aid=311076&label=postbooking_confemail Quantity 1 room Total room price â‚¬ 517.50 Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Awful!!!”
Reviews.Author: nancysm
Reviews.Content: Way overpriced!!!! $800 euro for one night of no sleep do to banging air-conditioner or some mechanical noise!!!!! Manager would do nothing but go up and say he heard nothing... I said to sit there for 1/2 hour and wait for it to start... it seemed to be on and 30 minute cycle or so.... ugh!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “MY ADVICE - NEVER USE THID HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: CHIOA
Reviews.Content: An absolute rip off. Not value for money!! very small room, rubbish toiletries. Ill-mannered staff, do not know the meaning of hospitality - rude, utterly digraceful. The breakfast consist of cold fod- bread, no toast no fresh beverages.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH YOUR TIME OR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: isabelavv
Reviews.Content: The rooms are tiny and not thoroughly cleaned. I made the mistake of buying a wi-fi package of 20 hours for 25 euros but could only use it one day as there was poor reception in my room, when tried to talk to staff was treated very disrespectfully by Massimo the Assistant Manager who was extremely rude and said it was my problem and that there was nothing he could do. There are so many hotels in Venice that this one is honestly not worth it, prices are extremely high since you are near San Marco, rooms are closet sized and the bathrooms small and not cleaned properly, breakfast they serve is horrible and to top it off they have extremely rude staff that believe they can treat guests however they want. DO NOT USE THIS HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “Great location but pricey”
Reviews.Author: AnuTexas
Reviews.Content: For tourists visiting Venice for the first time, this hotel is conveniently located directly behind St. Markâ€™s Square, one of the key attractions in Venice which includes St. Markâ€™s Basilica, Dogeâ€™s Palace and the Clock Tower. It is surrounded by restaurants and retail shops including both high end stores and smaller boutiques local to Venice. Additionally, it is only a ten minute walk from the nearest Vaporetta stop (the water taxi used to travel to and from Venice as well as around the island) and about a 25 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge and Grand Canal, the other two main attractions in Venice. Within the hotel, the customer service was mediocre â€“ the staff seemed inconvenienced when asking responding to basic questions about navigating around the island, asking for food recommendations, etc. The rooms were very small but I think this is consistent across most hotels in Venice. The price point is more than desirable but again, you are paying for the location and its convenience so a fair trade off. All in all, I would probably stay there again only for its location, nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “A rather expensive touristic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elenisavvopoulou
Reviews.Content: Wood and. "gold"This is the hotel's style. My room was big enough like a junior suite . But there was a lot of noise(there was a restaurant 5 meters far of my windows).Do not prefer room no 302! The hotel is so close to San Marco church that when you go out you meet many people just out of the door.If you like to be at the absolut center of Venice it's OK . Breakfast is not so good .It's clearly a 3 star breakfast. I wondered why because they should know that breakfast is sometimes of equal importance with the room itself. If someone wants to go to Venice in a not so. Crowded place I advise him to go to Dorsoduro sestiere .I saw some very nice hotels there.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent locations, small cozy rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Paxcal
Reviews.Content: Just next to San Marco's square. The hotel has a very nice and cozy look. Rooms have an excellent large bed but are relatively small, but extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: WendyK1976
Reviews.Content: Top location. Near San Marco square. Small hotel but with good service. Helpfull staff. Clean but small rooms. Breakfast is ok. The location is the best for this hotel. Near every sight.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: c0ffey
Reviews.Content: Just off St. Mark's square - easy to find. Friendly staff very helpful and offered us too a free boat trip to Murano. Great recommendations on local restaurants. Rooms really nice in the Venetian style and extremely clean. Nice Bathrooms with shampoo, shower gel, caps, soap. Breakfast was much better than we expected. Fresh juice, nice coffee and tea selection, cereals, yogurt, fresh fruit, croissants, donuts, bread rolls,ham, salami, cheese, omellete and crispy bacon. Would highly recommend. It worked out at Â£85 for double room including breakfast for 2 guests. Very near to the Hard Rock Cafe too. If you like hard matresses for your back - this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, but in great location.”
Reviews.Author: 1Spyros
Reviews.Content: It's located very near to San Marco, very helpful for your site searching and it's not far from the water-bus stop. The rooms are very clean...and that's all. Our room was probably in an "attic". The (tiny) elevator is not available in all floors, so we had to take the stairs too. The room was overpriced (ok, everything in Venice is) with no view at all, but what was worse is the size of the room. We had to do most things sitting on the bed because there's no room for anything else than the bed! Thank God Venice is wonderful, so we weren't that annoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for location - but not a four star hotel as claimed”
Reviews.Author: Heaths99
Reviews.Content: A great location, just off St Mark's Square and we assume that's how it gets it's four star status. The room was very small (often a problem in Italy; the sort where you bruise your shins as you try and navigate around the bed) and the bathroom miniscule. Plus point was the room and linen appeared to be very clean. No tea/coffee facilities and when asking at the bar for a late night cuppa; the request was met with disdain and begrudgingly fulfilled. Breakfast is very basic. Your usual buffet fare. We were also travelling with friends, they stayed in another hotel The Concorida and loved it. Our other guests were staying in a Venetian guest house two streets back from St Mark's and rated it very highly if all you're after is a good, clean room for the night with breakfast. Wouldn't recommend the hotel for price...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff- but no A/C in our room??”
Reviews.Author: jerseysl33
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff at the Royal San Marco is top notch. We arrived at 8 am, expecting to drop off our bags and begin the long wait until check in time exploring the area. Instead, because a member of our group was feeling ill, we were given a single room to occupy until our triple was ready. We rested in this room free of charge until our room was ready at around 11. The triple room was much larger and nicer, but the one major difference was the air conditioning. In the single room where we waited, the A/C was freezing cold and very powerful, but in the triple we booked for the rest of our trip the A/C was clearly broken. It didnâ€™t get cold at all, never mind it getting as cold as it had in the single room. We called the front desk and were told it would be fixed the next day. This did not happen and again we called the next night and were told the same thing. We asked for another room and were told none were available. We were there for only three nights, and during those three nights the A/C never worked. We slept with the windows open, but it was still brutally hot and sticky, especially after taking a shower. This major failure by the maintenance team was really a shame, and somewhat of a shock, considering we broke a shelf in the bathroom and it was fixed while we were out to lunch without us having notified anyone of it having been broken. The efficient fix of the shelf led me to believe the A/C unit needed some serious repair, in which case we should have been moved to another room. This air conditioning issue is a shame because our stay would have been spectacular if it had been slightly cooler, and I know that this hotel is capable of such because we experienced it in the first room! I would have given it nearly perfect raitings if they had fixed the A/C!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible rooms,”
Reviews.Author: Eli155019
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a standard room with queen bed and were very surprised when we were taken to what can only be described as an attic. After getting off the elevator on the 4th floor, we had to walk up two flights of stairs. Our room was the size of a closet and had two single beds. There was mold on the ceiling and the shower temperature ranged between scalding hot and freezing cold. After asking for a change of room, we moved to the second floor, which had a double bed (well, two singles pushed together, actually). The room was not any bigger and this shower only did cold water. Breakfast buffet was edible, but below the quality of most other hotels we stayed at. Hotel staff weren't exceptionally friendly. Location is good - it is very close to San Marco Square.

Reviews.Title: “An ok 4 ****”
Reviews.Author: julz1e
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed there for 3 nights, they claimed to be a 4**** hotel. Price isn''t cheap, location is great, staff language barrier really need to be improved. We were given a very small room, basic utilities were provided, very clean, breakfast is not much to choose from and be sure to be there before 10AM, or else nothing's left!

Reviews.Title: “San Marco”
Reviews.Author: PaulB60
Reviews.Content: Very central, steps away from St Mark's Square and vaporetti stops. Nice breakfast, quiet and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: eghack
Reviews.Content: This is very nice, clean and has a nice staff But the best about it is the location, a few steps from piazza de San Marco. Lost a few points because donÂ´t have free internet.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing start to our Italy trip”
Reviews.Author: TravelswithTeens42
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the Torre Dell'Oroligo suites part of the San Marco. The idea was to have a huge suite to unwind in as we began our 18-day trip and this was a splurge. The disappointments started at checkin when we were given a one bath suite vs. the two bath suite we had paid for. Luckily we had our paperwork but this error still killed the following morning as we switched rooms. Service from staff was mostly awful. It took 4 phone calls and 24 hours to get extra pillows to the room. The kitchenette promised had no silverware, plates, cups, pots or pans. Just a stove top and minibar. The staff was all very young and unskilled at customer service. One woman yelled at us for trying to use the Internet in the lobby (the only place it worked and a freezing 50 degrees) because it was after 9 pm. No restrictions were posted but we were supposed to know this? The property misrepresented their Internet service to us prior to booking but didn't seem concerned. The suite was pretty but we had to go outside, down an alley and then up two flights of stairs to access our 'Internet in the room'.

Reviews.Title: “Location provides an authentic Venetian atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Amoke1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, as it is only a couple of minutes away from St Marks Square, where there is so much to see and do all day and evening. We had a triple room with good views, one of which was canal facing close to one of the many quaint little bridges that dot the whole of Venice. The compact bedroom and bathroom were very clean and comfortable. Breakfast could have been a little better and more varied, the dining room was a bit too tight. But this was a very minor problem when one has the experience of staying in an old Venetian palace!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location”
Reviews.Author: hildaPerthWA
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just off St marks Square and although small, is very convenient for everything in Venice. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the breakfast (free) was a typical european buffet style. Adequate but not fancy. i got a good deal over the internet and would recommend booking this way. I would recommend this hotel for the situation and the price.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but great location”
Reviews.Author: Hockeybod
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on the way to a conference. I had heard that Venice hotel rooms were small and I wasn't disappointed, but then I only spent a few hours there anyway. It was hard to find - stand in the square with St Marks on your right, and it is just left of centre down a small passage signed to the Rialto. The location couldn't have been better, so I would rate it good value. Breakfast was good with plenty of choice. At first glance the hotel looks a bit dingy and run down, but closer inspection reveals that is simply the style of the place. A couple of tips: coffee in St Marks Square was 10 Euros, but then I didn't expect it to be cheap, and the view was great. Get the water taxi to the Rialto and walk to St Marks which only takes a few minutes. It is quicker than the express water bus and half the price, plus you get to travel up the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment at every turn”
Reviews.Author: SquashMom
Reviews.Content: This is not a good hotel. First, the room we had was very small and the bathroom was even smaller. This room was given to us when I refused to go into the first, really tiny room that was offered to us. Since I am traveling with my teenaged son, the desk clerk got annoyed because the room she was offering me had two beds. To call them beds would be charitible -- they were more like cots, and with our luggage, we would not have been able to turn around. The second room was marginally better, but still extremely small. But the worst part of the experience was the breakfast. It was as if the hotel were suprised that people wanted breakfast -- there were neither enough tables nor dishes nor cups nor silverware to go around. There was one poor woman frantically trying to clear the tables while guests were eating cereal out of coffee cups, coffee out of juice glasses and buttering rolls with the handles of forks. It was purely amateur hour from the get go. The final indignity was the arrangements that the hotel made for us to get to the train station. We paid 80 euros for a private taxi to get us there on time, but no one bothered to mention that our train was not actually leaving from this station and that we had to travel to another station to catch our train. We barely made it with less than a minute to spare -- and these were non-refundable tickets. I had shown the tickets to the clerk who made our arrangements, and he never mentioned the fact that we had to go to a different train station. And don't even get me started about the internet issues and how unpleasant the clerk was who was supposed to be helping us. Here's the thing -- don't go into the hospitality business unless you really want to help travelers, something that didn't happen at this hotel. A small, uncomfortable room, bad service, a terrible breakfast situation -- why would you want to stay here?

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly pleasant Hotel, very nice!!”
Reviews.Author: humbert65
Reviews.Content: Great location, very clean and pleasant hotel. Makes your stay in beautiful Venice, a dream.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice rooms, not cheap!”
Reviews.Author: Zoeboey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in January for a business trip. as a single person, my room was small, but I think this is usual in central venice. The location is amazing, just a few hundred metres from St Marks Square - I paid Â£80 per room per night B+B which is not bad, but January is the lowest seaosn there is in Venice. The reception / breakfast area is very beautiful and a lovely first impression.I liked the decoration in the rooms, very venetian with the silk wall coverings and heavy curtains, but if you like light and modern you would find it a bit oppresive! My bathroom was very small, only a shower no bath, but new decoration and very clean. Breakfast was not bad, plenty of choice of cereals, cakes, pastries, bread, juice, yoghurt etc - but not what you'd call an american / english selection. The staff I spoke to were all friednly and attentive, I asked reception for a restaurant choice and was given directoins to a pizzeria that was nice and not too expensive. All in all I was not blown away but the hotel was nicely decorated, decent service, great location and not too bad value for money considering its venice!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: EJG2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel post cruise. After the reviews I had read I was very much surprised. It was a delightful experience. Rooms were beautiful and comfortable. The staff went out of their way to help us. Continential breakfast was delicious. We were very early for check in and were offered breakfast the first day even though we were just dropping off our luggage. We'd definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimnjan
Reviews.Content: Sorry to say that we only stayed one evening at this delightful hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful and the atmoshere was warm and comfortable. The rooms were a bit larger than expected. The location was good for shopping and dining and was about a 10-12 minute walk to the water taxis. I must say that the complimentry continental breakfast was the best I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small room”
Reviews.Author: Tania_Madrid
Reviews.Content: I booked Casa Verardo online at HotelClub, but when I arrived they did not have a room for me, so I had to look for another one. I found Royal San Marco at night, checked in at 10pm. They gave me a double for single use for 300 euros a night. To get in I had to cross St.MarkÂ´s Square, which was full of water. To cross it, I had to take off shoes, the water was as high as 15sm and it was around 10-15 degrees Centigrade. Very romantic beginning. The hotel looks nice, 4-star, but the rooms are tiny. I saw a single for 280 euros per night, and a bigger double for 450 euros per night. Ridiculous prices for this cells. My room had a tiny bathroom without a bathtub, the shower directly on the same floor, no shower tub. A tiny wardrobe. Very simple breakfast included. In the morning I woke up because of the noise, I thought it was raining, the windows were open. jaja, it was a shower in the next room. They also say the trip to Murano is included - itÂ´s a scum. The trip is paid by the factory held by Signoretti family and includes only a show in the factory of one tired guy who is blowing stupid horses in front of the public, and a quite big showroom with fine pieces of glass. The price of this glass includes the water taxi, the guide in Venice, the guide in Murano, a salesperson speaking several languages, and a commission to the hotel. Also if you ask about a restaurant, they would always recommend you one that pays them a commission, which does not mean itÂ´s a bad restaurant, but pricey. But in general, for Venice it seems to be a decent hotel, although I would not give a 4-star rating to it. It is clearly a good level 3-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location can not be beat!”
Reviews.Author: TrvlCrayZ
Reviews.Content: Basic Venitian style hotel, rooms are small and a little "gaudy" but the lobby it very nice, staff was very helpful and the location, I can't say enough about the location! I think I may have been able to hit San Marco with a rock. Seriously I counted and it was less than 50 steps into the square. Our room was in the top "attic" levels. Which was annoying, you take the elevator 4 levels then get off and walk two more. Not to convenient with luggage or after a long day of sightseeing. But over all the hotel was a GREAT value, $100 USD a night less than other things in the area. I would recomend it highly (at a good price) and I will stay again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Venetian delight!”
Reviews.Author: Dovic
Reviews.Content: A superbly well positioned hotel, with very helpful and welcoming staff, just ignore the fact that the rooms are a liitle small. That is of no importance in a city like Venice! Only 2 minutes walk from the main square, this hotel just made our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy room, et al.”
Reviews.Author: lsjhk
Reviews.Content: Room 105 was the tiniest room I have ever stayed in. Even the bathroom was meant for mini-me. In addition, it looked over a noisy street and bar and we were unable to fall asleep until the late hours of the night being kept up by the incessant noise. The shower was downright dangerous with temperatures varying from warm to scalding hot. The staff did nothing to fix the problem as the hotel was allegedly entirely booked. Breakfast was sub-par. The location was quite good and the staff at the front desk overall helpful however the night person chased my friend to the other side of the island thinking that she skipped out on her bill. We firmly believe this was racial profiling which the hotel denies. Regardless this staff person and my friend spoke before she left the hotel and he had an opportunity to ask her status with the room. Instead he waited and trailed her to the vaporetto stop on the other side of the island to ask her room number and to question her regarding the possibility of skipping out on the room tab. I was still in the room catching a later flight. At a minimum this behavior was unprofessional at best. All in all I'd never stay at this hotel again or in Venice for that matter as it is one big tourist trap.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...”
Reviews.Author: sthompse
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights about two weeks ago. The breakfast was good but it would always be nice when they offer you espresso in the morning instead of American coffee. Also, it would be great to have some taste of the local food for breakfast as they catered too much to American tastes. The location is excellent. The rooms are small, but you aren't living in your hotel roomin venice. My room was on the first floor and I had to deal with noise coming up from the ground floor - but I still slept well. I did get attacked my mosquitos in my room onmy last night - but not everyone can control nature. If you want to stay in the centre of it all - stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: coordinatestravel
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Royal San Marco Hotel. We were boarding a cruise ship and wanted to spend a couple of extra nights in Venice. It was my first experience with a European hotel, because it was my first trip to Europe. The walk from the water taxis station in St. Marks Square to the hotel was horrific with bags packed for 25 days. We chose not to use a porter, but the day we headed to the ship we made sure we had 2 porters reserved. The Hotel was nice, the staff friendly. The rooms were ok very small, but comfortable. The hotel was not loud. The bathrooms were very clean and had great amenities. I enjoyed the warm croissants and Italian pastries for breakfast, and the juice was great. The one drawback for a first time visitor to Europe was it was August and hot and the Air conditioner was awful in my room. It seemed as I never stopped perspiring my whole time in Venice. Besides that I would stay there again because of the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Check carefully before booking”
Reviews.Author: Jerseyan
Reviews.Content: Our family of 10 members spanning three generations stayed in the Royal San Marco for three nights. Two people were first assigned to a room which was on the sixth floor (only the first four floors were accessible by elevator), was barely large enough for two cot sized beds with a narrow walking space between them and had an odor so unpleasant that the room could not be considered habitable. After much discussion with the desk personnel, the room was exchanged for one of equally bare furnishings and space but without the terrible odor. Another of the rooms was for three people and again not pleasantly appointed but at least habitable. Only the two rooms on the first floor had been renovated recently and were very attractive. Our rooms had been booked through a travel agent via American Express and we were unable to determine the rate for the rooms. We requested this information because we were unable to justify an equal amount being paid for double rooms of such disparate quality. It is safe to say that we would not be able to recommend this hotel to anyone who might possibly be assigned to any room above the first floors. The hotel is well located.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Newcastlekath
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a 3-night stay at the above hotel, where Â£477 B & B bought us what was virtually a boxroom with 2 narrow, uncomfortable beds and hardly any other furniture. There was room in the tiny wardrobe for only one of us to unpack; my husband graciously offered to live out of his suitcase. The single, rather dim, central light did not allow for bedtime reading and small amount of floor space was entirely bare. The emulsioned walls were badly scuffed and marked. The bathroom was adequate, but did not make up for the lack of amenities in the room. We requested a move the next day and were given a much larger room for the remaining 2 nights. At first we gave no thought to the inter-connecting door in the corner, until 3 noisy adults moved in that night, and we realised we had been given half of a suite. It was embarrassing, to say the least, to hear every word of their conversation, every zip unzipped, even teeth being brushed! Oblivious to our loudish hints, coughs, stirrings etc. they continued until the early hours. The dining room is undersized too, and staff are clearly stressed at having to reset so many tables so often at breakfast, while a queue forms outside. The recent grand refurbishment of the hotel is only in evidence in the reception area - we saw no evidence of it elsewhere. However, the reception staff were as helpful as they were able to be under the circumstances, and most efficient at booking trips and tickets for us. Of course it goes without saying that we loved Venice and will certainly return as soon as we can afford to stay in an even more expensive hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Seriously, don't bother”
Reviews.Author: ZeldaSayre
Reviews.Content: If it is your aim to be near San Marco square, and you don't mind anything else being terrible - then stay here. But let me tell you, the room was seriously smaller than a store room or large closet. The floor was warped up into sharp areas where the wood had been corroded by a burst pipe or something - you could not do anything at all but sleep in that room. And barely that since one of the beds was just a metal framed cot. Will never stay there again. You are so much better off staying away from any tourist areas and having a nicer hotel and room, since Venice is so small you can easily walk anywhere. Also, the breakfast buffet was small and horrible and the coffee was mud. Out of every person who worked there only one woman gave us the time of day. What a waste of money! Though the city of Venice was lovely!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: bjg74
Reviews.Content: Before leaving for my honeymoon I read all of the Trip Advisor reviews for Royal San Marco (after we booked it) and went in expecting the worst. It turned out to be the best hotel we stayed in on our travels through Italy. The staff were kind and helpful. Our room was small but lovely and very clean...and of course the location was phenomenal!!! A stones throw from the Piazza San Marco. It appears that we got one of the renovated rooms. Our bathroom was small, but by far the most spacious relative to the other Italian 3 star hotels we stayed in. The bed was comfortable as well. Breakfast was fine, but what I appreciated was that on request you could have fresh espresso brewed for you. My husband I will definitely stay there again on our next trip to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a birthday present I had arranged for my partner and I was throughly disappointed and embarrassed by the quality of this hotel. When we arrived, we were told we couldn't stay in the hotel and were asked to stay in an altnerative hotel for the first night, which I could only describe as comparable to hostel accommodation - certainly not worth Â£200 a night. Although we had our bathroom, the toilet was literally situated under the shower, which flooded every time we used it. The second and third nights were spent in the hotel we had originally booked with, Royal San Marco. V good location and the centre of the action. However, terribly decorated and maintained - wall paper falling off the walls, unplesant, noisy, dirty, unappealing ... a complete disappointment and not the 'luxurious and romantic hotel' I was hoping for! Very expensive and disappointing. When we complained we were told there was nothing they could do, they were in the process of renovating the hotel, so presumably it will improve in time.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely expensive”
Reviews.Author: lolaborro
Reviews.Content: This 3 star hotel is fine. The hotel is in a privileged position at a stone's throw of St Marco Square. The rooms are well decorated, everything is in working order and the breakfast selection is fair for a 3 star hotel if it wasn't because their prices are those of a 5 star hotel. We paid 247 euro per night. For half that, I can get a room at the Hilton on Park lane in London... We had not choice but to stay there because Lastminute booked us on another hotel and when we got there, they had not received the booking so we had to find something else and this is the only one with availability we could find (not surprised they had availability with those prices!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Not totally finished!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I shall start with the positives: the location is good, and the breakfast was adequate. I would agree with everyone in saying that the lobby casts a very good first impression. However... Having just returned from Venice I would like to say that the renovation work is by NO means complete. Scaffolds are still present (the clanging from which provides an unwanted alarm call at 8am). Painting/renovation is still taking place within the hotel. Add this to bagged up laundry which was forever present in the hallway of the second floor, and it sometimes felt like the set of a home improvement programme. It also appears that the hotel has two distinct types of room which vastly differ from each other. Our 'classic' room was tiny and unwelcoming, and the shower-room was a tiled cupboard. We also found that noise travelled from the plumbing and corridor more than we have found with any other hotel. All in all I wouldn't recommend staying here unless you make sure you are in one of their better rooms in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Refurb Work is Done!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dis-regard all previous posts about the workman/noise/hotel being remodeled....it is finished!! The end result is a really stunning little hotel. After reading so many bad reviews here, my wife and I were so pleasantly surprised with how lovely the hotel is now. Our corner room was actually a type of suite (a small sitting room and a bedroom with queen size bed), that overlooked a small canel on one side and the walkway/bridge to S. Marco square on the other side. Plenty of space in the room(s), clean & modern bathroom, decorated very nicely, and a very comfy bed! Staff was friendly, beautiful lobby (hotel bar a bit pricy though), good breakfast, and as others have noted excellent location. 4 star quality for 3 star price, cannot say enough good things about this hotel other then stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location.....”
Reviews.Author: Spriglet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in September 2005. There is one it has going for it and that is a great location. The first night we were lost in Venice so many times on the little streets and it was so nice to see the sign pointing us to our hotel....San Marco, follow the arrow. The hotel was clean and we had a nice bathroom with a real bathtub. That counts a lot when you walk as many miles as we do on holidays. The breakfast was one of my favourites. We were really quite pleased. We didn't find that the bathroom smelled. There was construction going on but we didn't hear much noise from it when we were there. We were at the back of the hotel facing the canal with a couple of gondolas parked below. We found that while not the most luxurious room it was really OK. Pleasantly surprised after so many terrible reviews.

Reviews.Title: “watch out for workmen”
Reviews.Author: herandthere
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, attractive and welcoming reception/dining areas, staff pleasant and helpful. The rest of the hotel was appalling. Every floor was in the midst of renovation and the, newly installed but not yet functioning, fire alarm system was taped over with notices instructing guests not to touch! Our initial room had no glass in the windows and was subsequently very cold. We were given another room but, although clean both were very dingy. This hotel booking was not a "special deal" and was at full cost and more than we might usually have paid to ensure a good location. The hotel should not have remained open for guests during such intensive renovation work. We did however have a wonderful time in Venice and would recommend a visit - just make sure your hotel is not in this state!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away for know”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel by CIT tours, the Canadian arm of Italiators in May/05. Lobby looks amazing - nice wood, marble etc. The bedroom floors are all under renovation with drywall, peeling wallpaper, renovation equipment in hallways, staff working with equipment. If they finish the bedrooms as nicely as the lobby is, this will be a nice hotel but in the meantime, look elsewhere. Just to cut down moving we asked about rates for an additional night and were quote 190 Euro -- much too high. We did end up staying the two nights but were moved to a room over a canal (that luckily didn't smell). The AC wasn't turned on yet so the room got stuffy. We booked a hotel the city tourism booth at the train station for the third night at a better rate and it was much nicer (140 Euro) -- hotel violino d'oro.
